meanings.def: the act of dismissing somebody from their job; an example of this
examples: He still hopes to win his claim against unfair dismissal.
The dismissals followed the resignation of the chairman.
Crash victims are calling for the dismissal of the bus driver.
His attack on the manager led to his instant dismissal.
She is now faced with dismissal on the grounds of misconduct.
These mistakes were not nearly serious enough to warrant his dismissal.
They were warned that they risked dismissal if the strike continued.
an employee claim for unfair dismissal

meanings.def: the failure to consider something as important
examples: Her casual dismissal of the threats seemed irresponsible.
Dismissal of the last piece of evidence as unreliable would severely affect our case.
His wholesale dismissal of women composers is indefensible.
his callous dismissal of her father's illness

meanings.def: the act of not allowing a trial or legal case to continue, usually because there is not enough evidence
the act of sending somebody away or allowing them to leave
the end of the innings of a player or team
